allowedValues: The unbunched electron beam is a continuous cylinder with circular cross-section.
The electron beam is a 3D Gaussian distribution in space.
The electron beam is a uniformly-filled 3D cylinder with circular cross-section.
The electron beam is a uniformly-filled 3D cylinder with elliptical cross-section.

gamma.description: Lorentz factor gamma for the cooling electron beam.

nu.description: Set the grid number in horizontal direction for the 3D integration.

nv.description: Set the grid number in vertical direction for the 3D integration.

nz.description: Set the grid number in longitudinal direction for the 3D integration.

coupling.description: Transverse coupling rate, ranging from 0 to 1.

particle.description: Name of particle to be used

charge_number.description: Number of the charges of the ion.

momentum_spread.description: Momentum spread of the ion beam.

particle_number.description: Total particle number for coasting ion beam or the particle number of one bunch for bunched ion beam.

rms_bunch_length.description: RMS bunch length for the bunched ion beam.

lattice.description: This file should be in the MAD-X output format (*.tfs).

elegantTwiss.description: This file should be the SDDS output from the twiss_output command.

step_number.description: The time interval of each step is time/step_number.

save_particle_interval.description: The interval of steps to save the 6D coordinates of the ions. No saving if the value is less than zero.

ref_bet_x.description: TWISS parameters for the reference point. Only needed when the Particle model is selected and the electron cooling effect is not included in the simulation.
